EmailTemplate.subject: Important Honeywell Process Change Notification
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear Valued Supplier,
Effective the weekend of June 6, a revision to the auto-PO process for VMI FLEX/2.0 was implemented, affecting only VMI orders that have active DPAS flow down.
Why are we implementing these changes?
As part of VMI FLEX/2.0 continuous improvement, we are refining the scope of parts that will significantly reduce the number of POs Honeywell triggers to our VMI FLEX/VMI 2.0 suppliers while reducing the administrative burden suppliers may be experiencing.
What do I need to do differently?
Please continue to follow the steps below as part of the standard process:
- Suppliers should maintain a sufficient quantity of parts at or above VMI bin levels - Suppliers should create sufficient POs to cover the current Honeywell forecast through the replenishment lead time (typically 14 days) - Suppliers should acknowledge the VMI FLEX PO quantity and provide the date the materials are expected to hit the Honeywell dock - Suppliers must always review and ensure compliance with flow down requirements in all VMI FLEX POs.
Who do I contact with questions?
Please refer to the available FAQs <[[https://pages3.honeywell.com/rs/641-QIX-912/images/Honeywell_FAQ-VMI-Flex-Auto-PO.pdf]]> . If you have any additional questions or concerns regarding this enhancement, please create a case within the Case Management tool in HASP. You can do so by logging into HASP then clicking this link <[[https://scc.honeywell.com/irj/portal/createcase]]>. You can also navigate to HASP>Support>Create Case, select “VMI” category and, finally select “Other VMI Issue” sub-category when submitting your case.
Thank you for your partnership to ensure on-time delivery to our mutual end customers.
